page.title: 04FARMING IN BADENOCH - 1
page.content:
{Farming}in this area is mixed due to the variety of terrain. {Beef and {mutton}are the main products. A farm of say about{six hundred acres}would support about seventy cows and calves along with twice as many sheep. About one seventh of this land would be used for growing{barley, potatoes, turnips {and hay}for the farm's own use. Some local farmers benefit from free grazing on part of the{RSPB Reserve.
Whereas{twenty years ago}the farmer would have employed about{six men}he can now run it basically on his own, calling on neighbouring farmers for help when necessary, eg at harvest. Big farm machinery, such as combine harvesters, is hired from neighbours when needed.
